X.ii.6.B.4.a
.
Consequences of the Marriage of a Child Deemed Permanently Incapable of Self-Support
Entitlement to benefits based on a child’s permanent incapacity for self-support ends when the child marries,
except
in the case of a child of a Spanish-American or Indian War Veteran.
Under the laws in effect prior to April 1, 1944, the marriage of children of Spanish-American or Indian War Veterans
merely creates a presumption that the child is no longer permanently incapacitated, and
under
38 CFR 3.950
, positive proof of continuing incapacity can overcome the presumption.
Reference
:  For more information on developing for permanent incapacity for self-support, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.B.2
.
